artist: Artist: Tsukioka Yoshitoshi; Publisher: Sasaki Toyokichi
creditline: Gift of Ellen and Fred Wells
description: man with long hair and long beard, holding a sword, wearing a grey kimono with a brown dragon on the stomach; green cowering demon at L; curtain and door at R
markings:
not identified seal (artist or censor)
Publisher:Sasaki Toyokichi
medium: Woodblock print (nishiki-e); ink and color on paper
portfolio: From New Forms of Thirty-Six Ghosts (Shinkei sanjūrokkaisen 新形三十六怪撰)
text: Tsukioka Yoshitoshi, like Kawanabe Kyōsai, whose painting Wisteria Maiden and Demon Priest is hanging nearby, was a student of Utagawa Kuniyoshi (1798–1861), the foremost designer of warrior prints in the mid-19th century. Yoshitoshi captured Shōki standing firm in a substantial breeze that makes his robe flow and long hair and beard swirl. A subjugated demon is holding the scabbard of Shōki’s drawn sword.
title: Picture of Shōki Capturing a Demon in the Dream
